young thai boxer 's world title bid .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for herefordshire and worcestershire have finished for the day but we 'll be back from 08:00 on monday with more live news , sport , travel and weather .

documents.title: travel : birmingham velo road closures
text: about 15,000 cyclist will be taking part in the birmingham velo on sunday , and some roads in north worcestershire will be closed .
here 's a list of where and when

documents.title: watch : gloucester squad to take on the warriors
text: the team announced by video - very flash .
you can hear full commentary on the m5 derby on bbc hereford & worcester from 19:00 tonight .
team news here is the gloucester rugby team to face worcester warriors in premiership rugby round 4 .
# glovwor

documents.title: watch : your evening and weekend weather forecast
text: it will remain largely cloudy overnight with a few outbreaks of rain and drizzle likely .
there will also be areas of hill fog .
tomorrow there will be lots of cloud around throughout the day with some brighter spells developing at times .
dry for most of the day with the risk of just a shower or two in the morning .
highs of 18c ( 64f ) .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: hereford packaging firms sold by administrators
text: gelpack industrial and gelpack excelsior in hereford have been sold by administrators .
the plastic packaging companies made up to 175 people redundant in august after suffering `` difficult '' trading conditions .
administrators kpmg say they firms have been sold to the visionscape group and that `` all remaining employees will transfer to the purchaser '' .
this is exciting news for us and after a successful run for over 40 years , we are committed to continuing to grow the business and carry on the legacy under new leadership and direction. ``

documents.title: watch : 'a good professional job '
text: kidderminster harriers ' striker joe ironside says their fa cup win was `` a good professional job '' and he looks forward to their next tie against newcastle benfield fc .
first up though at the weekend are blyth spartans at aggborough .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: heath trusts merger : union concern about job losses
text: a union fears a planned merger of two health trusts in gloucestershire and worcestershire will lead to `` serious disruption to staff , and job losses '' .
gloucestershire care services and the 2gether nhs foundation trust will begin by appointing a joint chair and chief executive .
the 2gether nhs foundation trust has 2,300 staff and runs mental health and learning disabilities services .
it also runs inpatient units in cheltenham , gloucester and hereford , including the stonebow unit (
unison say its priority will be to `` ensure that post-merger staff will still be employed on nhs contracts , with decent pay and conditions '' .
`` at first glance the proposals would appear a better option than bringing in private firms to run community services , '' a spokesman said .
before staff can be reassured , their unions need detail of what the trusts are planning and what this means for individuals , jobs and services . ''

documents.title: rugby : warriors ' squad for derby game
text: warriors have made three changes , notably ryan mills back at 10 and peter stringer starting for the first time at scrum-half .
you can here full commentary on the game from 19:00 on bbc hereford & worcester .
team news | @ twitterid returns to start at 10 while @ twitterid & jono kitto named on bench .
read more at
good to see @ twitterid starting .
it 's a good call # experiencewhereitcounts
bring it on @ twitterid @ twitterid let 's have some points from this game , your fans are behind you all @ twitterid
go well jono !

documents.title: graffiti menace ordered to clean up his mess
text: a teenage graffiti scourge who caused more than £ 7,500 of damage across worcester will have to clean it off as part of his punishment .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: watch : young thai boxer 's world title hopes
text: george rowand , from redditch , is only 12 but he 's already a uk thai boxing champion and he 's been invited to take part in the world thai boxing championships next month in italy .
but it 's going to cost the family around £ 2,000 to go , so they are busy fund-raising .
you can find out more on my show - you can catch it on the bbc iplayer .
author: Malcolm Boyden
Presenter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: man in court on stab death charge
text: man in court on stab death charge

documents.title: your malvern hills through the mist
text: this comes from jim carver , a west midlands mep who lives in worcestershire .
the view of the malvern hills from # worcester this morning , looking as magnificent as ever.. @ malvhillstrust
terrific view !
where abouts is this in # worcester ?
this was in # malvern this morning !

documents.title: man remanded in custody on murder charge
text: a 30-year-old man has appeared in court charged with the murder of a man in bewdley .
45-year-old andrew owen died after being stabbed in the neck and stomach , on sunday night .
shaun dewey , from cherry close , in the town , has been remanded in custody until 6 november by a judge at birmingham crown court .
author: Joe Baldwin
News Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: cyclist injured after collision with a car .
text: a cyclist suffered a broken collar bone and ribs after a collision with a car , police say .
west mercia police say the crash happened on pickersleigh road in malvern on wednesday and are appealing for witnesses .

documents.title: watch : giant veg show - how big is big ?
text: the national giant vegetables championship is being held this weekend as part of the autumn show at the three counties showground in malvern .
if you 've ever wondered how big the vegetables can get , take a look at this monster being unloaded from back of a 4x4 - it takes a forklift to move it .

documents.title: slideshow : raindrops on autumn flowers
text: one of our regular contributors , paul wilde , took these great close-up photos while on a walk in abbey meadows in redditch .
i 'd love to feature your photos on this page - you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: hospital trust to get share of £ 160m new technology fund
text: the trust running hospitals in herefordshire is to get a share of a £ 160m government fund to allow new technology to be used to deal with patients more efficiently .
the grant means the trust will be able to replace paper records and printed orders - instead it will use computers to arrange patients ' prescriptions , place orders and make referrals .
the trust has already introduced an electronic patient record system , and the money will be used to extend this over the next 18 months .
it will allow us to have the right information in the right place at the right time , which will help us move patients through our care more efficiently and effectively . ''

documents.title: rugby : ben te'o in england training squad
text: worcester warriors ' ben te'o has been named in a 33-man england training squad for a camp in oxford this weekend .
england play argentina , australia and samoa in november .
head coach eddie jones will name his squad for the autumn internationals on 26 october .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: what 's that helicopter doing flying so low ?
text: if you see a yellow helicopter flying lows around stourport and hereford today do n't worry - it 's checking overhead electricity lines for western power distribution .
the company likes people to tweet photos of its helicopter at work , so get snapping if you see it .
today our helicopters will be patrolling in # stourport # hereford # telford # stoke and # devon .
# wpdspotted

documents.title: travel : lines between hereford and worcester reopen
text: they were closed at about 10:45 due to `` trespassers on the line '' , london midland said .
# hereford lines are now open .
apologies for the disruption .
please check @ twitterid for service information .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: slideshow : misty autumnal morning
text: there was plenty of mist around first thing this morning , and bbc weather watchers were busy with their cameras .
i 'd love to feature your photos on this page - you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: rugby : three changes for warriors ahead of derby game
text: worcester warriors have made three changes to their starting line up for tonight 's aviva premiership trip to gloucester .
ryan mills ( is fit again and will start at 10 , where he 'll form a new half-back pairing with peter stringer , who will get his first start at scrum-half for the club .
alafoti faosiliva comes into the pack .
there will be full commentary on that game as part of a rugby special from 19:00 on bbc hereford and worcester .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: travel : road transport replaces trains between hereford and worcester
text: london midland says the problem is caused by trespassers blocking the rail line .
road transport has been ordered to run between hereford and worcester foregate street
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: reservoir at beauty spot could be drained
text: a reservoir at a popular worcestershire beauty spot could change drastically under plans being put forward by severn trent .
the water company says it no longer needs the british camp reservoir near malvern .
the reservoir was originally constructed to supply malvern with water , but severn trent says that 's no longer the case , so it no longer fulfils its original purpose .
the firm proposes demolishing the old buildings at the site and either fully or partially draining the basin .
this is a preliminary proposal to check reaction before the company makes a formal application .
author: Justyn Surrall
BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: travel : rail lines blocked in hereford
text: london midland says trains through the station could be delayed or cancelled .
due to trespassers on the railway at hereford all lines are blocked , services running through this station may be delayed/cancelled
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: stourport high increases capacity
text: a stourport school which is undergoing a multimillion-pound transformation is increasing admission places to help the county cope with rising pupil numbers .
author: Kidderminster Shuttle

documents.title: velo 100-mile cycling event : your comments
text: a massive cycling event takes place this weekend in staffordshire , the black country and worcestershire .
on sunday , 15,000 cyclists will follow the 100-mile route of velo birmingham through the midlands , much of it on closed roads .
here are some of the comments you 've been making on facebook :
how will it effect me ?
should one of my family ever need to be cared for by mcmillan nurses , money raised from the velo may help with their care .
my husband is diabetic and money raised from the velo may one day find a cure for the disease . ''
all taking part on the public highway .
a definition of highway is an area of land which the public at large have an absolute right to use to pass and repass without let or hindrance .
i appreciate the need to close roads to carry out road repairs , or install or repair utilities but for a sporting event ? ''

yes okay , the money will be raised for macmillan nurses etc , but what about district nurses or carers that may already be visiting a member of your family , but ca n't get through because the roads are closed ? ''
velo birmingham ?
hardly any of it is in birmingham . ''

documents.title: watch : card games for charity 's gain
text: card players in worcester have held their first cafe bridge session to raise money for acorns children 's hos
worcester bridge club hopes the regular events will also help introduce people to `` the joys of this very complicated game '' .
i went along to learn more about the game and how they hope to use it to raise money for charity .

documents.title: court appearance on murder charge
text: a man is due to appear in court later charged with the murder of a man in bewdley .
andrew owen ( 45 , suffered stab wounds to his neck and stomach in cherry close on sunday night .
shaun william dewey , 30 , from cherry close , is due before birmingham crown court .
he 's also been charged with the grievous bodily harm of a 53-year-old man .

documents.title: recovery worker left trapped between cars after crash
text: a recovery worker dealing with a broken-down car has suffered a serious leg injury after another vehicle ran into the back of his van , the ambulance service says .
west midlands ambulance service says it was called to pershore lane in hindlip , worcestershire at 15:40 yesterday .
a 4x4 hit the back of the recovery van , and the mechanic had become trapped between the van and the broken-down car .
he was treated at the scene by ambulance staff before being taken by land ambulance to the major trauma centre at the queen elizabeth hospital birmingham . ''

documents.title: watch : massive marrows and colossal carrots
text: about 1,000 massive vegetables will be on show in malvern this weekend , as the national giant vegetables championship comes to the three counties showground .
it 's part of the malvern autumn show , which is expected to attract about 65,000 visitors .
i 've been to meet one of the champion growers .
author: Justyn Surrall
BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: get ready for 15k cyclists on the roads
text: fifteen thousand cyclists will take to the region 's roads on sunday for the first velo birmingham .
the race is proving controversial as some businesses along the 100-mile route are concerned that road closures in staffordshire , the black country and worcestershire will damage trade .
many roads will be closed throughout the area - check whether you 'll be affected on the website .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after a foggy start for some , there 'll be some decent sunshine around this morning , but cloud will increase later bringing some rain with highs of 17c ( 63f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

text: welcome to the local live service for herefordshire and worcestershire on a misty friday morning , as you can see from this by bbc weather watcher , annie 's scenes .
i 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .

BBC News Online

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: rare butterfly makes a comeback
text: one of the uk 's rarest butterflies has returned to worcestershire after a three-year project , according to a conservation trust .
butterfly conservation says the wood white butterfly is found in only 50 sites across the country .
it has now been reintroduced in the monkwood nature reserve , which is jointly owned by butterfly conservation and the worcestershire wildlife trust .

the project to reintroduce the butterfly in worcestershire was funded by a £ 98,400 grant from the heritage lottery fund ( hlf ) and with support from the seven waste environmental fund and the forestry commission .

on just one summer 's day we counted as many as 70 wood white butterflies and we can confirm that we 've seen females laying eggs , which is really exciting news for the future of this species at monkwood . ''

documents.title: more than £ 160k available for voluntary groups
text: voluntary and community groups in redditch can apply for grants from a fund of £ 161,000 .
the money is being offered by the borough council to individuals or groups who encourage independent living , who are making the local community safer or need help developing a business .
anyone who wants to apply for the grants can go to an information event at the town hall on monday , 9 october between 17:30 and 19:30 .

documents.title: slideshow : autumn blooms add colour
text: as the skies are a bit grey and drab today , bbc weather watchers have been taking the chance to photograph some colourful blooms .
i 'd love to feature your photos on this page - you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: weather : a clear night and some sunshine tomorrow
text: the rain is finally beginning to clear and we should have a clear night , with some sunshine tomorrow .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: all-women shortlists : your comments
text: the labour party has decided that its candidate to stand in worcester at the next general election will be chosen from an all-women shortlist .
here 's what you 've been saying about the decision on the bbc hereford & worcester facebook page .
i 'll vote for whoever has a positive effect to my constituency , not for the best woman ! !
for goodness sake , how patronising is this to female parliament candidates . ''
utterly mistaken .
one wonders at the lack of good sense in such a proposal .
the first to refuse it should be the women . ''
good to see them hitting quotas rather than getting the best person for the job . ''

documents.title: series of fires being treated as arson
text: six separate fires in leominster are being treated as arson by police , who say they are investigating whether the incidents are linked .
a car and hedging were set on fire in marlborough close ( as were a portable cabin on south street , an electricity box and a sign in gateway lane and fence panels in holme lea .
west mercia police says the incidents all took place on wednesday and thursday of last week .

documents.title: theatre 's seating appeal hits its target
text: malvern theatres has raised the money needed to replace its seats in the festival theatre , a significant milestone for the landmark building .
author: Malvern Gazette

documents.title: watch : five-year-old writes to the queen about nurses ' pay
text: i 've been to meet a worcestershire girl who has been `` surprised and delighted '' to get a response to a letter she wrote to the queen .
frankie vaughan , who 's five and lives in malvern , wrote to the queen to ask for a pay rise for her mother , who 's a nurse .
author: Justyn Surrall
BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: football : city extend keeper 's loan deal
text: worcester city have extended the loan deal with kidderminster harriers that has brought keeper tom palmer to the club .
palmer was originally brought in for a month before city 's game with loughborough university - the deal has now been extended for another month .

documents.title: positive discrimination still needed says former labour candidate
text: an all-women 's shortlist is going to be used by worcester labour party to find their next parliamentary candidate .
the decision has been made by the party 's national executive committee , with labour 's candidate for the next general election expected to be in place by december .
the last time all-women shortlists were used by labour in worcester was when councillor joy squires became the city 's parliamentary candidate six years ago .
she 's says she believes positive discrimination is still necessary .
the other parties do need to look long and hard at why they do n't attract women .
if you look at the city council [ in worcester ] , where we use all women shortlists , labour has half of its councillors [ who are ] women . ''

documents.title: extra money for schools welcomed by council
text: extra funding for schools in worcestershire has been welcomed by the county council .
the local authority expects to get a funding increase of about 2.4 % in 2018-19 and a further 1.5 % in 2019-20 as a consequence of the new government funding formula .
education secretary justine greening , speaking in the house of commons , repeated a previous pledge to give schools an extra £ 1.3bn from 2018 to 2020 .
this announcement is welcomed and is good news for worcestershire and its schools .
it is a testament to all the years of campaigning for fairer funding by head teachers , governors , schools , parents and the local authority .
we will be working through the detail of the announcement to consider the implications for worcestershire schools . ''

documents.title: public back police and fire service plans
text: more than 60 % of people are in favour of the region 's police and crime commissioner also taking over the fire service , a consultation has revealed .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: pedestrian killed in car crash
text: a pedestrian has died after being hit by a car in martley , worcestershire .
police say the 60-year-old man was taken to the queen elizabeth hospital in birmingham with serious head , pelvic and leg injuries , where he later died .
police are appealing for witnesses to the incident , which happened on sunday in church lane .

documents.title: council sorry for contract 'catastrophe '
text: council sorry for contract 'catastrophe '

documents.title: watch : full steam ahead at heritage railway
text: the ffestiniog railway in wales has lent one of its locos for the severn valley railway 's annual steam gala .
here it is in action , with one of its bigger brothers .
little and large at highley this morning - come to the engine house and meet prince !
@ twitterid

documents.title: 'explosions ' reported after fault at electricity substation
text: fire crews were called to a herefordshire village early this morning following reports of two explosions .
they happened in peterchurch about 02:30 and the noises were followed by a flash of light .
western power say it was down to a fault at their substation - the power did go off but was restored within half an hour
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: cricket : moeen part of england team looking for second win
text: worcestershire all-rounder moeen ali is at trent bridge as england look for a second one-day international win against the west indies .
the west indies won the toss and put england in - you can follow the game on the bbc sport live page .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: couple purchase astley vineyard with ambitious plans for the future
text: an intrepid couple have elected for a `` ambitious '' lifestyle change and bought an established vineyard in stourport .
author: Kidderminster Shuttle

documents.title: road closure advice ahead of 100-mile bike ride
text: velo birmingham is taking place on sunday - with thousands of cyclists pedaling their way through the open roads of the west midlands .
so motorists be advised , many of the roads will be closed throughout worcestershire , staffordshire , birmingham and the black country .
here 's a map so you can check to see whether you 're affected
the closures will also be affecting public transport .
check the velo birmingham website for full details of road closure , as some are closed from midnight on saturday .
# bus velo cycling event this sunday .
buses in # birmingham # bearwood # halesowen # stourbridge diverted .
visit
author: Stephanie Barnard
BBC Local Live

documents.title: gloucestershire and herefordshire nhs trusts to merge
text: two nhs trusts which serve gloucestershire and herefordshire are set to merge into one organisation .
the 2gether nhs foundation trust and gloucestershire care services ( gcs ) will begin by appointing a joint chair and chief executive .

seven inpatient units in herefordshire , including the stonebow unit ( in hereford , are run by the 2gether nhs foundation trust - it provides specialist mental health and learning disability services .
chairs ruth fitzjohn ( 2gether ) and ingrid barker ( gcs ) said a merger would `` improve the experience and outcomes our patients and service users receive '' .

documents.title: fire authority chair believes takeover compromise is possible
text: there could be room for compromise over the west mercia police and crime commissioner 's plans to take over fire authorities in shropshire , herefordshire and worcestershire .
the chair of shropshire 's fire authority , eric carter , said this morning : `` i do n't want to fall out with john campion on this . ''
he says he is prepared to look again at the way the fire service is governed and that further savings might be possible .
but mr carter drew the line at the pcc taking control , saying he did n't think it was right the fire services were run by `` one person sitting in a remote office in worcester '' .

the police and crime commissioner repeated his argument that opposition to the merger was coming from fire authority members worried about losing their jobs , but mr carter hit back by saying `` i 've got a job wider than being chair of the fire authority , i 've served as a councillor for this borough for 26 years '' .
and he countered a pcc poll , which came out in favour of the merger , by pointing out a similar poll in the shropshire star came out strongly against the merger .
he also hinted that mr campion could be made a voting member of fire authorities - at the moment he sits on them as a non-voting member .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rugby : growing injury list for warriors ahead of derby game
text: worcester warriors will have to make changes for tomorrow night 's trip to gloucester as their injury list continues to grow .
both jonny arr ( and tom heathcote will miss out due to concussions , while matt cox and niall annett up injuries during training this week .
warriors shipped more than 50 points in losing at kingsholm last season .
there will be full commentary on tomorrow night 's game as part of a rugby special on bbc hereford and worcester .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: parents fear for children 's safety following loss of lollipop man
text: worried parents have been left fearing for the safety of their children as they cross a busy road to and from a stourport school after they lost their lollipop man .
author: Kidderminster Shuttle

documents.title: 'safety and security ' sweep at jail
text: an operation is being carried out across a worcestershire prison as part of a clampdown on violence , drugs and mobiles phones .
the prison service says the search at hmp hewell is meant to improve `` safety and security '' .
it 's part of a national crackdown by the ministry of justice , which says anyone found with illegal items will be subject to disciplinary action and police investigations .
author: Tim Race
Producer, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: pcc hits out at criticism of fire service takeover plans
text: west mercia 's police and crime commissioner has hit out at councillors who 've criticised his plans to take control of the fire services in the area .
shropshire and hereford and worcester 's fire services are currently overseen by fire authorities made up of local councillors .
john campion says his plan could save £ 4m a year .
councillors across the counties have spoken out against the plans - but a public consultation suggests 61 % of people support pcc john campion 's idea .
the fire brigades union in shropshire said it would `` vigorously oppose '' any move to remove its fire control from the county .
i 'm not surprised local authorities are concerned about this .
some of those councillors will lose their paid role on the fire authority , but for me this is about public safety . ''

documents.title: blueschool house overspend : your comments
text: the council has apologised `` unreservedly '' after an office refurbishment went £ 970,000 over budget .
a damning audit report said staff at herefordshire council did n't follow rules or guidelines and gave out contracts without asking for tenders .
here are some of your comments from the bbc hereford & worcester facebook page .
there 's no engagement between us , the people of hereford , and the local authority from what i can see so how can they represent us ?
they are out of touch with the people .
i guess they gave no budget for pr but it costs nothing to listen . ''
this is also one of the problems with this cabinet system that all councils now seem to operate under .
too many decisions are taken behind closed doors .
not even some of the other councillors know what happens in some cabinet meetings . ''
heads should roll .
they wo n't , but they should .
is it possible to file a law suit for misappropriation of public money ? ''

documents.title: stuck lorries causing traffic chaos 'about once a month '
text: lorries get stuck about `` once a month '' due to a satnav error , causing traffic chaos and damaged cars .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: dangerous cycling : road safety rules must 'keep pace '
text: the transport minister and hereford mp jesse norman says cycling has become so popular that `` we need to make sure that our road safety rules keep pace with this change '' .
the government is considering whether an equivalent offence to causing death by dangerous driving is needed for cyclists .
cyclist charlie alliston , who killed kim briggs ( while riding a fixed-gear bike with no front brakes , was convicted under victorian law .

mr norman said the government review will consider how the law should be updated `` so there is a proper legal remedy if a pedestrian is seriously injured or killed by a cyclist '' and whether or not there should be a new law .

we already have strict laws that ensure that drivers who put people 's lives at risk are punished but , given recent cases , it is only right for us to look at whether dangerous cyclists should face the same consequences . ''
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: blueschool house overspend : council must show 'lessons have been learned '
text: people need to be shown that `` lessons have truly been learned '' by the council after the refurbishment of offices in hereford went £ 970,000 over budget , the taxpayers ' alliance says .
blueschool house ended up costing taxpayers £ 1.92m , double the original budget - the overspend was approved by staff without cabinet members being told .
the council has apologised `` unreservedly '' for the overspend - it says it has has begun a review of its internal procedures following the findings of a damning audit report .
in a statement , the authority says it is `` disappointing for us all to find that some colleagues , however small in number , did not observe the correct procedures '' .

councils need to reassure tax payers that they are getting value for money because councils make these mistakes so often , and so often they apologise , move on , and make the same mistakes time and time again .
so to re-win the trust [ of tax payers ] they have to show the lessons have truly been learned . ''
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: svr plans hoping for funding boost
text: the severn valley railway is using its annual steam gala , which starts today , to launch a final push to raise the money to redevelop bridgnorth station .
the railway 's charitable trust is still £ 1m short of the £ 2.5m target .
the share offer has to close at the end of next month .
four special visiting steam engines will be showcased during the four day event along the 16-mile route from kidderminster to bridgnorth .

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: rain pushing in this morning , but this should clear this afternoon leaving something a bit drier and brighter with highs of 17c ( 63c ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: worcester city stadium : council backs plan
text: a council committee has backed `` in principle '' plans to secure worcester city fc a long-term home at parsonage way , the club says .
worcester city council would put £ 100,000 from the city plan fund towards the cost of building a community stadium on a site near the m5 motorway .
the plan was backed by the council 's policy and resources committee at a meeting last night .
the stadium would be leased long-term to the worcestershire football association , which would then sub-let it to the club .

worcester city fc say they will be working with `` a number of parties '' to submit an outline planning application for a pitch , a stand , a club house and flood lights at the site , which would be available for community use .

documents.title: your christmas goods on sale - time or crime ?
text: look what the police on foot patrol found on sale in a shop on the retail park - the countdown to christmas is on .
foot patrol on malvern retail park , christmas goods in september , crazy ! !
however only 96 sleeps til the big day .
not that i 'm counting

documents.title: tribute to boy cyclist killed after collision with car
text: the family of a 16-year-old boy who died after colliding with a car while riding his bike say he had `` a wicked sense of humour and made us all laugh .
he lived life to the full '' .
samual orchard was cycling along buckle street , honeybourne around 13:20 on thursday , 14 september when his bike was involved in a crash with a silver land rover freelander .
he was taken to hospital with serious head injuries where he subsequently died , police say .
sam was the most pure , sincere , and loving boy a parent could ever hope to wish for .
he made us and all his family extremely proud . ''

documents.title: watch : 'some of our execution let us down at critical times '
text: worcester warriors ' director of rugby gary gold says `` some of our execution let us down at critical times '' in the defeat to the exeter chiefs .
on the positive side he can look forward to the return of their south african international scrum-half , francois hougaard .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: blueschool house overspend : council apologises 'unreservedly '
text: herefordshire council has apologised `` unreservedly '' for the £ 970,000 overspend when council offices in hereford were being refurbished .
blueschool house ended up costing taxpayers £ 1.92m , double the original budget - the overspend was approved by staff without cabinet members being told .
an audit report into the overspend said key staff had `` knowingly disregarded council process and procedure '' .
the council says it has has begun a review of its internal procedures following the findings of the audit .
in a statement , the authority says it is `` disappointing for us all to find that some colleagues , however small in number , did not observe the correct procedures '' .
on behalf of herefordshire council , i would like to apologise unreservedly .
herefordshire council prides itself in trying to ensure best value for money for herefordshire residents in all our projects and in this project we failed to do so . ''

documents.title: weather : some rain tonight and tomorrow
text: we are forecast some rain tonight and we 're going to see more tomorrow , some of it heavy in places .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: new pay deal debated by council
text: a new four-year pay deal for its 300 employees will be debated by wyre forest district council at the end of this month .
the council says the deal would mean a pay increase worth 1.5 % in 2018 , followed by a further 1 % in each of the following three years .
the increases could be made without job losses , the authority says .
the council says it was `` not possible to reach agreement with the unions and therefore the report sets out steps which will now be taken to secure implementation '' .
this will include further consultation with unions and staff , its statement added .
the proposal will be debated by the council on wednesday , 27 september .
we recognise that staff in the council and across the public sector have experienced pay restraint for many years as a result of the government 's austerity programme .
we could pay higher increases but the stark reality is that we would have to fund it by cutting jobs. ``
the bbc has yet to receive a response from the unison union representing workers at the council .

documents.title: bewdley fatal stabbing : man sent to crown court on murder charge
text: a man has appeared in court charged with the murder of a man in bewdley .
shaun william dewey , 30 , of cherry close , bewdley , who also faces a charge of grievous bodily harm , did n't enter a plea when he appeared at redditch magistrates ' court today .
he 's due to appear at worcester crown court on 22 september .

documents.title: slideshow : sunsets , sunrises and clouds
text: the autumn clouds have given us some spectacular sunsets , sunrises and cloud formation , as you can see from these from bbc weather watchers .
i 'd love to feature your photos here - you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: robbers brandishing baseball bats demand driver 's keys
text: robbers wearing balaclavas and carrying baseball bats demanded a driver 's car keys as they parked up outside their hagley home .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: couple banned from keeping animals after dog starves to death
text: a couple have been banned from keeping animals for 10 years and fined a total £ 240 after one of their dogs starved to death and another ( was described by the rspca as `` a walking skeleton '' .

at worcester magistrates ' court , danielle rogers , 19 , of durham road , worcester , and 19-year-old keeley scott , of chedworth drive , worcester , both admitted two charges of causing unnecessary suffering to an animal .
the surviving dog has been nursed back to health and rehomed , the rspca says .
those poor dogs were locked inside a flat , hidden away from view and left to slowly die .
their basic needs simply were n't met and as they lost more and more weight their owners simply ignored them . ''

documents.title: man dies after car hits tree while towing
text: a 21-year-old man has died after his car hit a tree in buckle street , honeybourne , worcestershire , police say .
west mercia police says the man was towing another car prior to the collision .
the accident happened at about 16:40 yesterday .

documents.title: worcester warriors seek new investment
text: worcester warriors seek new investment

documents.title: school on old park-and-ride site plan approved
text: plans to build a new school on an old park-and-ride site have been approved by the council .

worcester city council says it has been looking for a site in the north of the city where a new free school could be built - with the rivers c of e academy trust identified as its preferred provider .
the council says it has spent nearly £ 50,000 securing and maintaining the park-and-ride site at perdiswell since it closed .

the vast majority of parents want to send their children to a school close to where they live - this decision will not only meet future requirements , but will take considerable pressure off existing schools in the area . ''

documents.title: finstall scientist takes pet-testing protest to the sky
text: a scientist from bromsgrove took part in a sponsored `` wing walk '' to show her support for animal-free medical research .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: appeal launched following fatal collision
text: witnesses to a fatal collision - in which a 21-year-old man died after his car hit a tree on the warwickshire/south worcestershire border - are being asked to step forward .
the man was driving a silver ford focus when the incident occured on buckle street in honeybourne on tuesday afternoon .

documents.title: nhs trusts take first steps to merge
text: two nhs trusts which serve gloucestershire and herefordshire are set to merge into one organisation .
the 2gether nhs foundation trust and gloucestershire care services ( gcs ) will begin by appointing a joint chair and chief executive .
in a statement , the trusts said `` a combined provider of mental and physical services could benefit many of the people we separately support '' .
the trusts will put forward a business case then begin the legal process .
click here to read more .

documents.title: tardebigge lock flight : the longest in the country
text: boaters who negotiate the 30 locks of the tardebigge flight , the longest in the country , can now get a certificate from the canal and river trust to mark their achievement .

documents.title: watch : european title bid by women 's tug-of-war team
text: the hopes of welsh tug-of-war at this week 's european championships will rest in the hands of a club from herefordshire .
cupids hill , who are based near grosmont , will be sending both a men 's and a women 's squad to southport for the championships .
i spoke to some of the women 's team about their hopes .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: consultation backs commissioner 's fire authority merger plan
text: plans to bring fire authorities in shropshire , herefordshire and worcestershire under the control of west mercia 's police and crime commissioner have got the backing of nearly two thirds of the people who responded in a public consultation .
the pcc 's office said it received 1,307 responses over three months and that 60.7 % said they supported the proposal .
the idea got the greatest backing in herefordshire , where 87.6 % came out in favour , but it was least popular in the shropshire council area , where only 56.5 % approved .
councils in the three counties have all opposed the move , but a final decision would be made by the home office .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: what are the most popular baby names in the west midlands ?
text: muhammad is the most popular boys ' name in the west midlands with amelia taking the top spot for girls .
the office for national statistics ( ons ) has revealed its annual results for england and wales .
oliver remains the top boys ' name for england and wales with olivia replacing amelia as the most popular baby girls name .
harper has seen the biggest rise in popularity for girls while jaxon is growing among boys .
the statistics were compiled based on the exact spellings given on birth certificates .

documents.title: bromsgrove advertiser back page : master class at back sees rouslers to win
text: this match was not a turning point but it served to prove , if indeed it was ever required , that sporting can compete and hold their own at this level of football .

documents.title: councils write to health secretary over 'unrealistic ' bed-blocking targets
text: eleven local authorities across the west midlands have written a joint letter to the government , to complain that targets for reducing bed blocking are `` unrealistic '' .

they also question nhs data that suggests delays in getting patients discharged are down to local authorities ' failure to provide sufficient adult social care - they say the blame should lie with the hospitals themselves .

the 11 authorities also complain that the threat from nhs england to withhold funding if they fail to meet the target for reducing delayed discharges would have a `` catastrophic impact on local people '' .

they have asked for more time to meet the target of a 3.5 % reduction and added `` the way that nhs england has sought to impose unrealistic targets and threatened the withdrawal of funding '' has damaged relationships which could affect future hospital redevelopment plans .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football : bulls ' fa cup tickets go on sale
text: tickets for hereford fc 's fa cup tie against afc hornchurch have gone on sale .
the tie takes place at edgar street on saturday , 30 september .

documents.title: murder charge after bewdley stabbing
text: a man has been charged with the murder of a man found with stab wounds at a house in bewdley .
the 30-year-old from bewdley has also been charged with grievous bodily harm of a 53-year-old man during the same incident on sunday , and will appear at redditch magistrates ' court later .
police have named the man who died as 45-year-old andrew owen ( from bewdley
in a tribute , his family have described him as `` so kind-hearted and would go out of his way for anyone and everyone '' .

documents.title: the longest lock flight certificate on offer
text: narrowboat owners who complete the longest flight of locks in the country can now get a certificate marking their achievement .
there are 30 locks in the flight at tardebigge which take boats up or down 220ft ( 67m ) on the worcester & birmingham canal .
people keen to claim their certificate can do so by scanning on a qr code located on posters on the flight or by emailing the canal and river trust .

documents.title: how big daddy match inspired jonny to wrestle in front of 10,000
text: a worcester-born wrestler who has fought in the us , africa and japan returns to the city after six years this weekend .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: road closure will hit trade claim businesses
text: there are calls for temporary traffic lights to be used instead of a complete closure on a stretch of the a4103 between hereford and worcester .
some businesses between fromes hill and leigh sinton say the resurfacing work is putting their livelihoods at risk with the road closing between 08:00 and 18:00 in the evening each day .
work started on monday and will finish on friday , 29 september .
steve moorman has only been running the red lion at stiffords bridge ( for three months and says he 's already lost at least £ 1,000 when there were partial closures of the road for duct work .
what the effect of this total closure will be is quite terrifying - we 're hoping it wo n't be more than 75 % down . ''

in a statement , herefordshire council said : `` the daytime closures on the rural sites have good alternative routes - however , inevitably , given the scale of this investment in the county 's roads , the works will result in delays for some motorists . ''

documents.title: bromsgrove advertiser front page : 'death threats ' in parking war
text: a `` war '' over parking outside a special needs school in bromsgrove has allegedly resulted in death threats .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: watch : training for tug-of-war european championships
text: i 've been to meet members of a herefordshire tug-of-war club who will be taking on the best in europe this week when they represent wales at the european championships in southport .
cupids hill tug of war club from grosmont qualified after winning the welsh championships .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: massive overspend on office revamp discussed by council
text: a report into how an extra £ 970,000 was spent on a council building in hereford without guidelines being followed will be discussed by the council today .
blueschool house ended up costing taxpayers £ 1.92m , double the original budget - the overspend was approved by staff without cabinet members being told .
an audit report into the overspend said key staff had `` knowingly disregarded council process and procedure '' .

documents.title: woman fined for carrying out illegal teeth whitening
text: a woman has been fined £ 500 by kidderminster magistrates ' court after admitting practising dentistry illegally by whitening people 's teeth .
hannah davies , of cobden street , kidderminster , carried out teeth whitening at her salon in the town .
she was also ordered to pay £ 1,000 in costs .
the dentists act 1984 says that to practise dentistry legally - which includes teeth whitening - an individual must be registered with the general dental council .
by performing dentistry illegally , patients are placed at serious risk of harm . ''

documents.title: new bromsgrove boat named after brave little girl
text: a boat-building business in bromsgrove has named its newest vessel after a five-year-old girl with cerebral palsy .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: children 's services takeover : 'we 're going to have to make a substantial difference '
text: the man in charge of child protection for worcestershire county council has admitted the authority has `` slipped into a place [ we ] do n't want to be '' .
a government-appointed commissioner has ruled the authority should hand over its children 's social care department to an outside operator .
an inspection by ofsted found `` widespread and serious failures '' and service was given an inadequate rating in january .
the council now has until december to look at possible options .
andy roberts , the cabinet member responsible for child protection , says the authority has accepted the criticisms and knows it has to make big changes .
we 're going to have to make a substantial difference - it 's not a tweak , it 's not just a bit of cash or a couple of extra staff , it 's a real difference . ''

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: it 's a dry morning with bright or sunny spells .
there 'll always be some cloud about , which will turn the sunshine hazy at times .
it will feel warmer than it has done recently with highs of 20c ( 68f ) .
author: Mel Coles
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning from today 's herefordshire and worcestershire live page
text: welcome to the local live service for herefordshire and worcestershire on wednesday morning .
we 'll have a full weather forecast for you in 20 minutes , but here 's a great shot of yesterday 's sunset from bbc weather watcher , happysnapper71 .
i 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .

BBC News Online

documents.title: children 's services to be taken over
text: children 's services to be taken over

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: rugby : warriors injury list sparks short-term loan signing
text: worcester warriors has signed scrum-half jono kitto on a short-term loan from leicester tigers after a run of injuries to key players .
number nines luke baldwin and jonny arr are out with a bicep injury and concussion .
kitto , a former new zealand under-20 international , has made 29 appearances for tigers .

documents.title: essex council appointed to improve children 's social care in worcestershire
text: another council is being brought in to help worcestershire county council improve the running of its children 's services .
the services were rated `` inadequate '' following an ofsted inspection in january .
essex county council has now been appointed as worcestershire 's `` improvement partner '' .
worcestershire county council say that experts from essex will work alongside its officers to deliver `` long term improvements '' .

we remain absolutely committed to that and we have already allocated an extra £ 5.1m into improving children 's social care in worcestershire this year essex will support us to deliver the improvements that we need to deliver . ''
a recommendation to `` voluntarily place children 's services into a different form '' will be discussed at this month 's cabinet meeting , the council says .

documents.title: weather : light cloud tonight and tomorrow
text: we 're forecast a dry night and more of the same tomorow , with some light cloud around .
temperatures are expected to reach 18c ( 64f ) .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: horror film director hopes for festival tour and online streaming
text: the creator of a new horror film , mainly filmed in redditch , is hoping to get international attention when it 's released next year .
penny for the guy started out as a short film , before getting noticed by an american producer who funded the longer version of the story .
film-maker nigel buckley says he hopes it can get onto one of the major streaming services like amazon or netflix .

according to the international movie data base the film centres on a down-and-out called frank who spends his days drinking and begging in the local underpass until a visit from a stranger changes his life forever .
we are hoping for the first year after its made we 'll tour the film festival circuit , which is what most ind films do hoping to get noticed .
after that it will be released on dvd and also the online streaming services . ''

documents.title: fish survey carried out after concerns raised by anglers
text: a specialist team from the environment agency ( ea ) have been carrying out a fish survey on the river avon in evesham following concerns raised by anglers .
chris bainger , from the agency , says that catches at the recent evesham angling festival were `` really poor '' - a problem highlighted by an article in the angling times .
a fisheries monitoring team have been carrying out a netting survey today to check on the numbers of young fish in the river .
initial results were `` very encouraging '' , mr bainger said , with plenty of young chub , roach , bleak and perch being caught and returned to the river .
the results are encouraging for the future of the river , but the young fish `` may evade the anglers for a couple more years yet '' , he said .
the environment agency will follow up this monitoring with further survey work early next year .
we will also look to discuss further habitat and access improvements work we can do in partnership with the local angling groups and the angling trust .

documents.title: breakingchild services taken out of the control of the county council
text: a government troubleshooter has decided that worcestershire county council should hand over the running of its children 's social care department to an outside operator .
it follows an inspection by ofsted back in january which graded the service as `` inadequate '' .
the county council has until december to look at the possible options .
author: Tom Edwards
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: increase in complaints due to 'change in procedures ' say police
text: a 44 % increase in the number of complaints about west mercia police is due to a change `` recording procedures '' and an effort to make sure `` people are able to make complaints more easily '' , the force say .
the independent police complaints commission ( ipcc ) say there were 733 complaints against the mercia police in 2016/17 , compared to 509 the previous year .
in a statement , the force say the ipcc figures are `` helpful to us in making improvements '' .
it is vital that on the occasions where we do fall short of delivering the correct level of service , we acknowledge that as soon as possible , and do everything we can to put that right . ''

documents.title: cricket : moeen snares windies opener
text: worcestershire all-rounder moeen ali has taken the key wicket of opener evin lewis as england take on the west indies in a 50-over match at old trafford .
you can follow all the action on the bbc sport live page .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: pub closure leaves village without a local
text: regulars at a pub in bromsgrove say they have been left `` wandering the streets '' since their local closed down earlier this month .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: slideshow : autumn leaves and sunshine
text: after the morning mist cleared it 's been a sunny autumn day , as these by bbc weather watchers show .
thanks to geoff 's garden , pix elated , paul wilde and morning amble for this selection .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: warriors sign tigers scrum-half kitto
text: warriors sign tigers scrum-half kitto

documents.title: cadbury 's staff are sweet on pay deal
text: staff at cadbury 's milk processing plant near leominster have voted in favour of a pay deal which unions say will counter rising inflation .
along with workers in birmingham and wrexham , the marlbrook team backed the two-year deal , which also includes an increase in maternity pay .
unite say the package guarantees a cost of living pay increase for staff .

documents.title: man who told police he wanted to 'cut muslims ' heads off ' fined
text: a hereford man who told police officers he wanted to `` cut muslims ' heads off '' has been given a fine by magistrates .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: image of man released in armed robbery probe
text: a cctv image of a man police want to trace following an attempted armed robbery at a garage has been released .
west mercia police say texaco garage on tolladine road , worcester , was targeted by a man wielding a gun .
he ordered staff to let him in but they refused he fled the scene .
the robbery attempt took place about 01:25 on 13 august .

documents.title: wolverley ale lovers set for three day treat
text: a popular wolverley beer bash promises to be bigger and better than ever when it returns next weekend
author: Kidderminster Shuttle

documents.title: cricket : moeen back in england side
text: worcestershire 's moeen ali is back in the england side for the one-day international against the west indies at old trafford .
the start has been delayed by rain - you can follow all the action on the bbc sport live page .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: west mercia force is slowest in the country at resolving complaints
text: west mercia police is the slowest in the country at resolving complaints , figures from the independent police complaints commission have revealed .
in 2016/17 the average number of days for the forces to conclude complaint cases was 183 , for those cases which did n't have to go to court .
the next highest was essex police , which averaged 162 days and the national average was 102 .

the figures also show 61 % of cases went to a full investigation , 27 % were dealt with through a less time-demanding local resolution and the remaining 12 % were either dropped or resolved more informally by the parties involved .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: nigel kennedy returns to malvern for two shows
text: violin virtuoso nigel kennedy is returning to malvern to play two shows .
the musician lived in west malvern for many years and often turned up at local pubs to play `` open mic '' nights .
he 'll be playing at the festival theatre , showcasing his new project in which he reinterprets the work of george gershwin .
also on the bill will be pieces by johann sebastian bach , and his own compositions .

documents.title: midlands questions to the pm-in-waiting
text: midlands questions to the pm-in-waiting
author: Patrick Burns
Political editor, Midlands

documents.title: lord digby jones : 'firms will come to flagship business park '
text: a former trade minister says worcester is not alone in struggling to attract new businesses .
four years after the £ 120m worcester six business park was given the go-ahead only one company has signed up .
worcester bosch , who were due to be the main anchor firm on the site , pulled out in 2012 .
lord digby jones says the park could still attract new tenants , if the developers play to the city 's strengths :
you 've got some fabulous educational facilities and you 've got quality of life .
academics , researchers and small entrepreneurs will love the atmosphere that worcester six can provide . ''

documents.title: slideshow : misty autumnal mornings
text: our team of bbc weather watchers have been able to get some spectacular photos this morning thanks to the misty start to the day .
thanks to fluff , mark fry , ant s , j9 and johnqa for this selection .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: county ins & outs 2017
text: county ins & outs 2017

documents.title: football : three teams in fa cup draw
text: kidderminster harriers and alvechurch face away trips in the third qualifying round of the fa cup , but hereford will have home advantage for their tie .
harriers face a long trip to newcastle benfield , who play in the northern league , while alvechurch will head to buxton .
hereford will be at home to afc hornchurch in their tie - hornchurch are in a lower league than the bulls , but they have won all six of their league games so far this season .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: robot mower is a big hit at malvern 's golf club
text: a malvern-based golf club has acquired a new member of its ground-keeping staff - a robot lawnmower .
author: Malvern Gazette

documents.title: your steam loco arrives by road
text: the southern railways locomotive , repton , is taking part in the autumn steam gala later this month on the severn valley railway .
it 's been loaned by the north yorkshire moors railway .
repton has arrived !
take care of her.want her in good shape for nymr gala
oh wow .
oh dear , we left the tender in yorkshire ! who 's going back for it ?

documents.title: cctv released after man viciously attacked after boxing match
text: images of a group of men wanted in connection with an assault shortly after the mcgregor v mayweather boxing match have been released by police .
a man in his 20s needed stitches in his face and suffered fractured teeth after he was attacked in hereford , police say .
west mercia police say the victim was verbally abused and then punched in the face by one of the men , knocking him to the ground and `` rendering him momentarily unconscious '' .
the assault took place on sunday , 27 august , just after 06:00 .

documents.title: worcester news front page : 'chaos ' as car crashed into wall
text: a man was taken to hospital after his car crashed into a wall in worcester .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: sharp rise in complaints against police
text: there has been a 44 % rise in the number of complaints made against west mercia police , according to figures released by a watchdog body .
the independent police complaints commission ( ipcc ) say there were 733 complaints against the mercia police in 2016/17 , compared to 509 the previous year .
the ipcc report does praise the force reducing the amount of time it takes to locally resolve allegations by 59 working days - the biggest drop nationally .
these account for 27 % of the total complaints received .

documents.title: neighbours ' shock after man stabbed to death
text: residents in a street in bewdley have expressed their shock after a 45-year-old man was found in a house with fatal stab wounds .
emergency services were called to cherry close on sunday night .
police are questioning a 30-year-old man on sus of murder .
we 've lived here since the houses were first put up and we 've never had things like this happen .
this is a good area - good for the kids . ''

documents.title: three bishops in a boat
text: three bishops are rowing down the river avon to tewkesbury today , to raise money towards the refurbishment of a retreat house and chapel .
holland house , at cropthorne near evesham , is an independent charitable trust which has been offering people `` opportunities for reflection and sharing with others '' since 1946 .
the trust needs to raise £ 100,000 for the renovation and upkeep of the house and the chapel .
the bishop of dudley , the assistant bishop of worcester , and the bishop of worcester are rowing the 20 miles in an old wooden rowing boat belonging to holland house .

documents.title: worcester six business park : concerns as only one firm commits
text: healthcare product business kimal has committed to a £ 120m business park being built off the m5 .
the firm , which is moving from its sites in droitwich and redditch , is the first firm to take up a unit at the 72 hectare ( 178 acre ) worcester six development .
worcestershire county council 's website says the development `` has the potential to create over 5,000 new jobs and give worcestershire 's economy a major boost '' .
the developers , stoford , are still confident firms will come to the new business park .
we 've definitely dialled up the tempo in terms of chasing occupiers down really pushing the site on the market .
to be fair to the council they 've really supported this by putting a lot of heavy investment in , which the private sector would n't have done without this . ''

documents.title: murder investigation continues after stabbing
text: police are still questioning a 30-year-old man on sus of murder , after another man was found stabbed to death at a house in bewdley .
emergency services were called to cherry close on sunday night .
a 45-year-old man was found with fatal stab wounds to his neck and abdomen .

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after a chilly start , with a few patches of mist and fog , it should be a clear bright day with highs of 16c ( 61f ) .

documents.title: good morning from today 's herefordshire and worcestershire live page
text: welcome to the local live service for herefordshire and worcestershire - it 's misty start to tuesday morning , as you can see from this by bbc weather watcher , gertcorf .
