documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow .
keep an eye out here for more updates and breaking news before then .

documents.title: 'tricky ' fa cup tie for harriers
text: the draw for the fa cup third-round qualifying has handed kidderminster harriers a potentially tricky tie at newcastle benfield who play in the northern league division one .
hereford will be at home to afc hornchurch who currently top the isthmian league division one north , while alvechurch face another away trip to higher-graded opposition - they will go to buxton .
the ties will be played on saturday , 30 september .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: residents ' fury at major route closure
text: people living on the a4103 , the main route between hereford and worcester , say a total closure of the road is causing chaos in nearby villages .
sections of the road near storridge will be closed for the next eight weeks for resurfacing with traffic diverted through bromyard .
brian g'napp has described the closure as `` a complete joke '' and says it took him an hour to get from his home in cradley to malvern this morning - a journey which normally takes 10 minutes .
it 's absolute chaos because people are coming through the lanes at mathon , but there 's only room for one car down there .
people who know the area are n't going to take a diversion all the way to bromyard .
why ca n't they close one side of the road at a time and put in traffic lights ? ''

documents.title: watch : latest weather forecast
text: plenty of showers tonight , but these should clear by the morning and tuesday is set to remain dry and slightly warmer than today .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: m5 quadruple fatality probe continues
text: m5 quadruple fatality probe continues

documents.title: man jailed an extra year for blowing up atm
text: a 26-year-old man has had his prison sentence extended by a year for blowing up a cash machine at a service station in evesham and stealing £ 12,930 from inside .
brennan hartrey pumped a mixture of acetylene and oxygen gas into the machine in cheltenham road through a small hole and then ignited it via a trail of petrol , the crown prosecution service said .

hartrey , who was already serving a six-year prison sentence for conspiring to cause explosions , today admitted to a further charge of causing an explosion likely to endanger life at stafford crown court .
brendan hartrey has carried out similar attacks on other cash machines and targeted this machine for its isolated location .
this attack caused over £ 20,000 of damage and loss .
despite its rural setting this machine was based at a petrol station making this an astonishingly dangerous incident . ''

documents.title: under 23s coach leaves harriers
text: kidderminster harriers have confirmed they have parted company with their under 23s coach , mark yates .
the harriers chairman colin gordon said they felt yates , who is a former first-team manager at aggborough , was unable to devote the amount of time needed for the role due to his other commitments .
harriers plan to announce his successor later today .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: nine-year-old girl thwarts dog snatcher
text: a nine-year-old girl has fought off a man who tried to steal her dog while she was walking in great malvern cemetery .
the girl suffered minor injuries to her wrist in the incident at around 13:30 yesterday as the stranger tried to forcibly take her pet .
she managed to flee the scene with her dog along madresfield road in the direction of pickersleigh road .
we 're extremely concerned about this incident which has been traumatic for the victim and her family .
we want to reassure residents that we are continuing to conduct patrols in the area . ''
author: Claudia Berry
Producer, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: your photos : noses to the ground in worcestershire
text: dogs and sheep are enjoying the smell of the fresh grass in worcestershire today .
thanks to bbc weather watchers sue hanstone in stourport and morning amble in ashton-under-hill for sending in these inspiring shots .

documents.title: worcester sports fields get £ 330k revamp
text: a £ 330,000 scheme to upgrade sports fields in worcester has been completed , creating five new full-size football pitches and one rugby pitch .
the development at perdiswell was funded by money given to the council by developers as part of planning agreements and the work became possible after previous drainage problems were resolved .
changing rooms next to the new pitches are also being refurbished .

worcester city football club youth teams are now able to hold their saturday morning games on the pitches and on weekdays they will be used for pe lessons by tudor grange academy and the heart of worcestershire college .
ensuring there are high-quality sports facilities in local communities across worcester is a real priority for worcester city council .
i hope these new pitches will give local people hours of enjoyment as well as exercise in the future . ''

documents.title: travel : worcester road closed after car hits wall
text: tolladine road in worcester has been closed after a car crashed into a wall , police say .
an audi struck the wall near to the building centre at about 12:40 today , blocking the road near to the junction with sheriff street .
two men and one woman were checked by ambulance crews for injuries .

documents.title: campaigners support cuts to local prescription list
text: a campaign group for lower taxes has spoken out in support of changes to prescriptions in worcestershire which come into force today .

as part of a drive to save £ 36m , health bosses in the county have told doctors they can no longer write prescriptions for a number of items including gluten-free food and over-the-counter medicines such as paracetamol .
the taxpayers alliance says the changes are a step in the right direction .
there 's a huge range of products and all this stuff is available .
i have friends and family who have dairy allergies , who have nut allergies , i mean where does it stop ?
surely the way to do this is not by getting people to go to a gp appointment which costs the tax payer about £ 45 just so they can get a loaf of bread ? ''
author: Justyn Surrall
BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: m5 fatal accident : police release further casualty details
text: three people - a 42-year-old woman and two children , a 12-year-old boy and a 10-year-old girl , remain in a `` critical but stable condition '' in hospital after saturday 's accident on the m5 which saw four people killed .
avon and somerset police said a full investigation is under way into the circumstances of the collision , which involved a mercedes van and two cars .
one of the victims was in a seat leon and three of the victims were in the second car , details of which we are n't able to release at the moment , '' a force spokesman said ,
the driver of the lorry , a man in his 40s from worcestershire , has been spoken to and has provided us with an initial statement .
our investigation will involve a thorough examination of all the vehicles involved and we 're working closely with the driver and vehicle standards agency ( dvsa ) to progress these enquiries . ''

documents.title: television builder denies assaulting police officers outside mcdonald 's
text: huntley thawe , from channel 4 's renovation game , flew into a `` godzilla rage '' before he was arrested outside a redditch mcdonald 's , his estranged wife told a court .
author: Redditch Advertiser

documents.title: murder probe after man stabbed to death
text: murder probe after man stabbed to death

documents.title: man arrested on sus of murder
text: a 30-year-old man has been arrested on sus of murder in connection with a fatal stabbing , police say .
the west mercia force found a 45-year-old man with fatal knife wounds to his neck and abdomen at an address in cherry close , bewdley , yesterday .
they attended the property after reports of a `` disturbance '' at about 23:30 .
his next of kin have been informed and are being supported by specialist officers .
author: Alistair Binney
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: worcester half-marathon `` big boost '' to city running event
text: a record number of runners took to the streets of worcester yesterday after a half-marathon was added to the city 's 10k event .
almost 4,000 had signed up for the young athletes run , worcester city 10k , and the inaugural worcester city half marathon - and thousands more lined the streets as spectators .
among the participants were 11-time paralympic gold medal winner baroness tanni grey-thompson and ben smith , the charity fundraiser who ran 401 marathons in 401 days .
the atmosphere was absolutely amazing out there and there was a lot of emotion on the course as runners pushed themselves to achieve their goals and raise money for good causes .
the 10k was pretty hard work in my day chair , but the fantastic support helped get me round and it 's been a wonderful experience . ''
author: Claudia Berry
Producer, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: bike race road closure warning
text: the organisers of the velo birmingham cycle race are reminding people living and working in worcestershire of extensive road closures ahead of the event next weekend .
the closures on sunday 24 september sparked anger among many residents and traders when they were first announced , with claims that whole villages would be cut off for most of the day .
the race organisers say they 're having to close roads along the entire route to ensure the safety of the riders .

the route has been carefully considered and selected through a partnership of all local authorities , emergency services and transport operators to minimise the inconvenience of the necessary road closures .
emergency services will be operating as usual and the public should use normal protocol in the case of an emergency . ''

documents.title: three seriously injured in fromes hill crash
text: three people were seriously injured in a crash between two cars on the a4103 , main hereford to worcester road , near to fromes hill .
the casualties were all taken to hospital after the collision between a blue ford focus and a blue nissan qashqai at about 18:40 on saturday .

documents.title: farmer faces eviction after being 'misled '
text: one of herefordshire council 's tenant farmers claims he has been severely misled as he waits to be evicted .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: amazing grace celebrates 111th birthday
text: grace jones from broadway celebrated her 111th birthday over the weekend .
she 's the oldest person in worcestershire and the sixth oldest person in the uk .
her secret is to have a drop of whisky with a little water every night .
i do n't feel any different from when i was 21 .
and do n't you worry , it 's not worth it , i do n't . ''
author: Kate Justice
Presenter - BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: rhodes signs new worcestershire deal
text: rhodes signs new worcestershire deal

documents.title: your photos : amazing skies
text: the sky 's the limit for photographers in herefordshire and worcestershire .
thanks to bbc weather watchers postman les in bromyard for this amazing of last night 's sunset , and mikesnapper for this beautiful shot of a misty morning in lower broadheath .

documents.title: local runner wins worcester first half marathon
text: the debut worcester half marathon was won yesterday by stuart hawkes from kidderminster .
almost 4,000 runners took part in events during the day including the city 's fourth 10k race which was also won by a local athlete .
jenny nesbitt won the women 's event for the second time , having previously beaten paula radcliffe back in 2014 .
author: Claudia Berry
Producer, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: reporter confronts spam texts pair
text: reporter confronts spam texts pair

documents.title: drunk man grabbed paramedic 's arm in worcester
text: kelvin king man lashed out a paramedic who was trying to help him after he was reported to be unconscious in a busy worcester street .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: no more gluten-free prescriptions in worcestershire
text: several items have been removed from the prescription list in worcestershire from today , as health bosses in the county attempt to make £ 36m of savings .
gluten-free products for people with coeliac disease and over-the-counter medicines like paracetamol will no longer be available on prescription .
the move has been criticised by coeliac uk because it comes ahead of a decision being made nationally on gluten free prescriptions .
i 'm just disappointed they 've not waited for the national decision , but have gone ahead regardless .

what we are worried about is that there are a number of people who are particularly vulnerable , because either they ca n't get to the shops that stock them or because they simply do not have the income levels required for very expensive gluten-free food . ''
the three clinical commissioning groups in worcestershire say the decision was taken following public engagement and the financial difficulties facing the nhs mean cuts need to be made somewhere .

documents.title: worcester warriors 10-41 exeter chiefs
text: sam simmonds scored two of five tries as champions exeter maintained their premiership stranglehold over worcester with a comfortable victory .
after converted first-half scores from simmonds , jack nowell and jonny hill , warriors replied straight after the break with prop biyi ali 's second try in six days making it 24-10 .
but chiefs stretched clear to seal an 11th straight win against worcester .

warriors , who lost on the opening weekend of the season at newcastle , have been done no favours by the fixture list , which threw up last season 's premiership top three wasps , exeter and saracen as their first three home fixtures .

to make matters worse , injuries in the match to tom heathcote and jack singleton mean the pair are expected to join the list of those unavailable for selection for the trip to gloucester on friday night .
author: Ged Scott
BBC Sport

documents.title: knife surrender launches in west mercia area
text: a four-week-long knife surrender has launched in shropshire , herefordshire and worcestershire .
west mercia police says anyone can anonymously hand in a knife or other bladed weapon in bins across area .
however , it is a surrender rather than an amnesty , so there 's no immunity from prosecution if it turns out one of the weapons has been used in a crime .
a similar campaign last summer saw more than 300 knives collected .

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after a chilly start it should be a dry morning with some sunny or bright spells .
cloud will thicken this afternoon bringing isolated showers with top temperatures of around 16c ( 61f ) .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: welcome to our live updates for the day
text: welcome to herefordshire and worcestershire live on monday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .
